system.description:
You are a brewmaster: an individual who has dedicated their life to the art of brewing beverages—beer, mead, wine, or even tea. With a careful eye and an elevated palate, you blend ingredients together to create a drink that isn’t just nourishing, but an experience to be had by all. One thing’s for certain, though: you always make friends no matter where you are. And for one reason or another, you’ve been called away on adventure.

Why did you set out on the road? Are you seeking new or exotic flavors that lie beyond your brewery or teahouse doors? Are you searching for a fabled master brewer to learn their secrets? Or are you seeking to hone your skills even further so that you may become the very best of your craft throughout the land?

Ability Score Increases: +1 to Constitution and one other ability score.

Skill Proficiencies: Culture, and either Nature or Medicine

Toolkit Proficiencies: Brewer’s supplies or a tea master’s set

Suggested Equipment (Cost 15–25 gold): Brewer’s supplies or a tea master’s set, traveler’s clothes, 5 Supply

Feature: Lend an Ear. People always seem more eager to share over a good drink. Whenever you are in a tavern or an inn, you gain an expertise die to Persuasion checks to coax rumors or information out of the locals.

Adventure and Advancement. As tales of your talents spread, you may be invited to participate in competitions or asked to join a brewer’s guild. Regardless, you attract the services of 4 acolytes who serve as apprentices of your craft.

Brewmaster Connections

  1. One of your regulars that’s always down for a pint or a cup of tea.
  2. The partner or apprentice you left at your brewery or teahouse.
  3. The trusty donkey who helps carry your kegs to market.
  4. A dissatisfied customer who slanders your reputation.
  5. The brewmaster whom you apprenticed under.
  6. Your close friend, who also just so happens to be your best taste-tester.
  7. The orange tabby cat who prowls your stores of grain.
  8. The farmer who provides you with the materials you use in your brews.
  9. A minor noble who frequently commissions you for their table wine.
  10. Your rival brewer, who tries to sabotage your brews every chance they get.

Brewmaster Mementos

  1. A sachet of dried herbs, roots, hops, and other flavoring agents.
  2. Your brew book with all of your treasured recipes.
  3. A wine key gifted to you by your former master.
  4. A cork from a favorite beer, wine, or mead.
  5. A silver teaspoon.
  6. Your favorite tankard, chalice, or teacup.
  7. A brass hydrometer.
  8. A small jar of yeast.
  9. Your grandmother’s bone china teapot.
  10. A bottle of a fine vintage wine.
